intro: Paraprasophyllum atratum, commonly known as the black-leaved paraprasophyllum, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its dark green to blackish foliage. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, often with a subtle fragrance. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
